channel.title: JaneBytes Cybersecurity Feed
channel.description: Summarized articles from top cybersecurity sources.

item.title: Chinese hackers breach US local governments using Cityworks zero-day
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Trimble Cityworks; CVE(s): CVE-2025-0994; Summary: The Trimble Cityworks GIS-based asset management software contains a high-severity deserialization vulnerability (CVE-2025-0994) that allows authenticated threat actors to execute code remotely on Microsoft IIS servers. The vulnerability was exploited by Chinese-speaking hackers, known as UAT-6382, to breach multiple local governing bodies across the United States.

item.title: New NIST Security Metric Aims to Pinpoint Exploited Vulnerabilities
item.description: The National Institute of Standards and Technology (NIST) and the Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency (CISA) have introduced a new security metric called Likely Exploited Vulnerabilities (LEV) to improve vulnerability management. The LEV metric aims to predict which vulnerabilities are most likely to be exploited, enabling organizations to prioritize remediation efforts more efficiently.

item.title: Critical Windows Server 2025 dMSA Vulnerability Enables Active Directory Compromise
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Microsoft Windows Server 2025; CVE(s): None; Summary: A privilege escalation flaw has been demonstrated in Windows Server 2025 that makes it possible for attackers to compromise any user in Active Directory (AD) by exploiting the delegated Managed Service Account (dMSA) feature. The attack simulates the dMSA migration process, allowing an attacker to gain similar privileges and breach the entire domain even if the organization's Windows Server 2025 domain isn't using dMSAs at all.

item.title: FTC finalizes order requiring GoDaddy to secure hosting services
item.description: GoDaddy has finalized an order with the FTC to secure its services after allegations of data security failures led to several breaches since 2018. The order requires GoDaddy to establish a robust information security program, secure APIs, and implement multi-factor authentication (MFA) among other measures.

item.title: Chinese Hackers Exploit Ivanti EPMM Bugs in Global Enterprise Network Attacks
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Ivanti Endpoint Manager Mobile (EPMM); CVE(s): CVE-2025-4427, CVE-2025-4428; Summary: The pair of security flaws allows execution of arbitrary code on a vulnerable device without authentication. They were exploited by UNC5221, a Chinese cyber espionage group, to target various sectors across Europe, North America, and Asia-Pacific. The attack chain involves targeting the "/mifs/rs/api/v2/" endpoint to obtain an interactive reverse shell and remotely execute commands.

item.title: New Best Practices Guide for Securing AI Data Released
item.description: The Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency (CISA), the National Security Agency, the Federal Bureau of Investigation, and international partners released a joint information sheet on AI data security best practices. The document highlights the importance of securing data used to train and operate AI systems to ensure their accuracy, integrity, and trustworthiness. It provides recommendations for organizations to adopt robust data protection measures, proactively manage risks, and strengthen monitoring and threat detection capabilities.

item.title: Webinar: Learn How to Build a Reasonable and Legally Defensible Cybersecurity Program
item.description: The article discusses the importance of having a structured cybersecurity program to meet legal and industry standards, citing new privacy laws, ransomware lawsuits, and regulatory investigations as examples of the increasing expectations on organizations. It promotes a free webinar hosted with the Center for Internet Security (CIS) that provides a practical approach to building a cybersecurity program that meets these standards.

item.title: Unpatched Versa Concerto Flaws Let Attackers Escape Docker and Compromise Host
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Versa Concerto; CVE(s): CVE-2025-34025, CVE-2025-34026, CVE-2025-34027; Summary: The Versa Concerto network security and SD-WAN orchestration platform has multiple critical vulnerabilities that can be exploited to take control of susceptible instances. These vulnerabilities include a privilege escalation and Docker container escape vulnerability (CVE-2025-34025), an authentication bypass vulnerability in the Traefik reverse proxy configuration (CVE-2025-34026 and CVE-2025-34027), which could allow remote code execution using LD_PRELOAD and a reverse shell.

item.title: Signal now blocks Microsoft Recall screenshots on Windows 11
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Microsoft; CVE(s): None; Summary: The Microsoft Recall feature, introduced in May 2024, continuously takes screenshots of all active windows every few seconds and analyzes them to build a database that can be searched using natural language. This has been criticized by security experts as a privacy nightmare and significant security risk due to the potential for attackers to steal user data.

item.title: Identity Security Has an Automation Problem—And It's Bigger Than You Think
item.description: New research from Cerby reveals that human error remains a significant threat to enterprise security, with few organizations having fully automated their core identity workflows. Manual processes and reliance on humans for tasks like password management, MFA enablement, and user provisioning leave organizations exposed to breaches and compliance failures. The study highlights the need for automation in identity security, citing a 41% manual sharing of passwords and an 89% reliance on users for MFA enablement.

item.title: UAT-6382 exploits Cityworks zero-day vulnerability to deliver malware
item.description:
FYSA:
The provided article appears to be a technical analysis of a malicious software campaign, specifically focusing on the VShell stager and its components. The article details the tactics used by threat actors to deliver malware through TetraLoader and VShell, as well as the characteristics of the CobaltStrike beacons used in this campaign.
Based on the provided information, I did not identify any specific vulnerabilities discussed in the article. Instead, the analysis highlights the techniques employed by malicious actors to evade detection and compromise target systems.

item.title: Versa Concerto 0-Day Flaw Enables Remote Code Execution by Bypassing Authentication
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Versa Concerto; CVE(s): CVE-2025-34025, CVE-2025-34026, CVE-2025-34027; Summary: Multiple critical vulnerabilities were discovered in Versa Concerto's network security and SD-WAN orchestration platform, including authentication bypass flaws, arbitrary file write vulnerabilities, and container escape techniques that allow attackers to fully compromise both the application and underlying host system. The issues stem from inconsistent URL processing and a Time-of-Check to Time-of-Use (TOCTOU) vulnerability in the AuthenticationFilter class.

item.title: Unpatched critical bugs in Versa Concerto lead to auth bypass, RCE
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Versa Concerto; CVE(s): CVE-2025-34027, CVE-2025-34026, CVE-2025-34025; Summary: Critical vulnerabilities in Versa Concerto allow remote attackers to bypass authentication and execute arbitrary code. Two critical issues (CVE-2025-34027 and CVE-2025-34026) allow for authentication bypass and remote code execution, while a high-severity issue (CVE-2025-34025) exposes host binaries to container writes, enabling full host compromise.

item.title: Hackers Targets Coinbase Users Targeted in Advanced Social Engineering Hack
item.description: Coinbase users are being targeted by a social engineering campaign that manipulates human psychology and leverages stolen insider data to execute highly personalized fraud. The attackers use a four-stage methodology that bypasses Coinbase's technical infrastructure, impersonating official support and using phishing emails and texts to guide victims into transferring assets.

item.title: Hackers Exploit PyBitmessage Library to Evade Antivirus and Network Security Detection
item.description: A new strain of backdoor malware is distributed alongside a Monero coin miner, utilizing the PyBitmessage library for covert peer-to-peer communications. The malware encrypts data exchanges and anonymizes identities, making it challenging to detect by antivirus software and network security solutions.

item.title: Several GitLab Vulnerabilities Enable Attackers to Launch DoS Attacks
item.description: Vulnerable Product: GitLab; CVE(s): CVE-2025-0993, CVE-2024-7803, CVE-2024-12093, CVE-2025-4979, CVE-2025-0679, CVE-2024-9163, CVE-2025-1110; Summary: GitLab issued critical security patches addressing 11 vulnerabilities across its Community Edition (CE) and Enterprise Edition (EE) platforms. The most severe vulnerability (CVE-2025-0993) enables authenticated attackers to trigger server resource exhaustion through an unprotected large blob endpoint, scoring 7.5 on the CVSS v3.1 scale.

item.title: Cisco Identity Services RADIUS Vulnerability Allows Attackers to Trigger Denial of Service Condition
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Cisco Identity Services Engine (ISE); CVE(s): None; Summary: The vulnerability allows unauthenticated remote attackers to cause a denial of service condition by exploiting flaws in the RADIUS message processing feature, causing affected devices to reload and disrupt network authentication services.

item.title: Grafana Zero-Day Vulnerability Allows Attackers to Redirect Users to Malicious Sites
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Grafana; CVE(s): CVE-2025-4123; Summary: The Grafana XSS vulnerability (CVE-2025-4123) allows attackers to redirect users to malicious websites, enabling execution of arbitrary JavaScript code. The vulnerability can be exploited without editor permissions and has a CVSS score of 7.6 (HIGH). It impacts all supported versions of Grafana OSS and Enterprise, including versions 11.2 through 12.0, as well as unsupported versions dating back to at least Grafana 8.

item.title: FBI and Europol Disrupt Lumma Stealer Malware Network Linked to 10 Million Infections
item.description: The article discusses the takedown of 2,300 domains associated with the LummaC2 infostealer malware by global law enforcement agencies and private sector firms. The malware is used to steal sensitive information from millions of victims for fraudulent purposes.

item.title: Attackers Exploit BIND DNS Server Vulnerability to Crash Servers Using Malicious Packets
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Internet Systems Consortium (ISC) BIND; CVE(s): CVE-2023-5517, CVE-2023-5679, CVE-2024-0760, CVE-2024-12705; Summary: The vulnerability in BIND DNS server software allowed attackers to crash DNS servers by sending specifically crafted malicious packets. This flaw could cause named (the BIND DNS server process) to terminate unexpectedly with an assertion failure when specific queries were processed with certain features enabled, posing a significant risk to DNS infrastructure and potentially affecting thousands of users and dependent systems.

item.title: New Process Injection Technique Evades EDR by Injecting Malicious Code into Windows Processes
item.description: Researchers discovered a novel process injection technique that exploits shared memory regions and thread context manipulation to execute malicious payloads without triggering standard detection heuristics. This method bypasses leading Endpoint Detection and Response (EDR) systems by avoiding traditional memory allocation and modification patterns, evading detection in multiple commercial EDR products.

item.title: ThreatBook Recognized as a Notable Vendor in Global Network Analysis and Visibility (NAV) Report
item.description: ThreatBook, a global leader in cyber threat and response solutions, has been recognized as a notable vendor in Forrester's Network Analysis And Visibility Solutions Landscape, Q2 2025 report. This recognition highlights ThreatBook's technical excellence and strong market performance in delivering real-time security insights across cloud, hybrid, and on-premises environments.

item.title: Russia-Aligned TAG-110 Targets Tajikistan with Macro-Enabled
item.description: This article reports on a phishing campaign attributed to TAG-110, a Russia-aligned threat actor. The campaign targets Tajikistan government institutions and educational/research bodies, using macro-enabled Word template files (.dotm) as lure material. The documents share VBA code with previous campaigns, indicating the group's persistence in targeting Central Asia. Insikt Group warns of potential further attacks and provides recommendations for detection and prevention.

item.title: Anthropic web config hints at Claude Sonnet 4 and Opus 4
item.description: Anthropic, the AI company, is reportedly working on new advanced AI models called Claude Sonnet 4 and Opus 4. These models are believed to be part of the Claude 4 series and are being tested or promoted internally with features like "show_raw_thinking" pointing to reasoning capabilities.

item.title: OpenAI hints at a big upgrade for ChatGPT Operator Agent
item.description: OpenAI's Operator AI agent, currently in research preview, will soon become a useful tool according to Jerry Tworek, VP of Research at OpenAI. The AI agent allows users to delegate web tasks and automate repetitive browser tasks, with plans for significant improvements soon.

item.title: Critical Samlify SSO flaw lets attackers log in as admin
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Samlify; CVE(s): CVE-2025-47949; Summary: A critical authentication bypass vulnerability allows attackers to impersonate admin users by injecting unsigned malicious assertions into legitimately signed SAML responses, impacting all versions of Samlify before 2.10.0. The flaw can be exploited with access to a valid signed XML blob, allowing unauthorized remote attackers to perform privilege escalation and log in as administrators.

item.title: Russian hackers breach orgs to track aid routes to Ukraine
item.description: APT28 (Fancy Bear/Forest Blizzard) hackers, sponsored by the Russian government, have been conducting a cyberespionage campaign targeting international organizations since 2022, compromising entities in defense, transportation, IT services, air traffic, and maritime sectors in 12 European countries and the United States. The hackers used various tactics, including password spraying, spear-phishing, and exploiting Microsoft Exchange vulnerabilities, to gain initial access and then move laterally within victim networks.

item.title: “Microsoft has simply given us no other option,” Signal says as it blocks Windows Recall
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Microsoft Recall; CVE(s): None; Summary: The Recall feature indexes Zoom meetings, emails, photos, medical conditions, and Signal conversations without user consent. It still takes screenshots of payment card details, decrypts database contents with a simple fingerprint scan or PIN, and lacks granular control for developers to prevent content indexing.

item.title: ZDI-25-306: Docker Desktop Helper Service Link Following Local Privilege Escalation Vulnerability
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Docker Desktop; CVE(s): CVE-2024-5652; Summary: This vulnerability allows local attackers to escalate privileges on affected installations of Docker Desktop, requiring low-privileged code execution and exploiting the WindowsContainersController class by creating a junction to delete a folder. An attacker can leverage this vulnerability to execute arbitrary code in the context of SYSTEM.

item.title: ZDI-25-307: Linux Kernel OpenvSwitch Out-Of-Bounds Read Information Disclosure Vulnerability
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Linux Kernel OpenvSwitch; CVE(s): ZDI-25-307, ZDI-CAN-26711; Summary: This vulnerability allows local attackers to disclose sensitive information on affected installations of Linux Kernel. An attacker must obtain high-privileged code execution to exploit this vulnerability, which exists in the handling of userspace attributes due to lack of proper validation of user-supplied data.

item.title: ZDI-25-308: Adobe Dreamweaver V8 Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Adobe Dreamweaver V8; CVE(s): CVE-2025-30310; Summary: This vulnerability allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code on affected installations of Adobe Dreamweaver. User interaction is required to exploit this vulnerability, which exists within the JavaScript engine due to a vulnerable version of V8.

item.title: Russia to enforce location tracking app on all foreigners in Moscow
item.description: The Russian government has introduced a mandatory tracking app for all foreign nationals in the Moscow region, aiming to tackle migrant crimes and strengthen control over migration. The app will monitor residence location, fingerprint, face photograph, and real-time geo-location. Critics argue that this proposal violates privacy rights and raises concerns about its feasibility and potential to deter labor migrants.

item.title: ZDI-25-291: (Pwn2Own) Mozilla Firefox IonMonkey JIT Compiler Integer Overflow Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Mozilla Firefox; CVE(s): CVE-2025-4919; Summary: The IonMonkey JIT compiler in Mozilla Firefox contains an integer overflow remote code execution vulnerability that allows attackers to execute arbitrary code on affected installations. User interaction is required, as the target must visit a malicious page or open a malicious file.

item.title: ZDI-25-292: (Pwn2Own) Mozilla Firefox SpiderMonkey Out-Of-Bounds Write Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Mozilla Firefox; CVE(s): CVE-2025-4919; Summary: The vulnerability allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code on affected installations of Mozilla Firefox. User interaction is required, as the target must visit a malicious page or open a malicious file. The flaw exists within the SpiderMonkey engine due to lack of proper validation of user-supplied data, resulting in a write past the end of an allocated buffer.

item.title: ZDI-25-293: Microsoft Windows Installer Service Link Following Information Disclosure Vulnerability
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Microsoft Windows; CVE(s): CVE-2025-29837; Summary: The vulnerability allows local attackers to escalate privileges on affected installations of Microsoft Windows by creating a symbolic link within the Windows Installer service, granting read access to arbitrary files and potentially disclosing stored credentials. An attacker must first obtain low-privileged code execution to exploit this vulnerability.

item.title: ZDI-25-294: Microsoft PC Manager MSPCManagerService Link Following Local Privilege Escalation Vulnerability
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Microsoft PC Manager; CVE(s): CVE-2025-29975; Summary: This vulnerability allows local attackers to escalate privileges on affected installations of Microsoft PC Manager by creating a symbolic link and abusing the MSPCManagerService, allowing deletion of arbitrary files. An attacker must first obtain low-privileged code execution to exploit this vulnerability, which can be leveraged to escalate privileges and execute arbitrary code in the context of SYSTEM.

item.title: ZDI-25-295: Trend Micro Apex Central widget getObjWGFServiceApiByApiName Local File Inclusion Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Trend Micro Apex Central; CVE(s): CVE-2025-47865; Summary: This vulnerability allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code on affected installations of Trend Micro Apex Central by leveraging a local file inclusion remote code execution flaw in the getObjWGFServiceApiByApiName function, requiring authentication to exploit.

item.title: Russian Hackers Exploit Email and VPN Vulnerabilities to Spy on Ukraine Aid Logistics
item.description: Vulnerable Product: None; CVE(s): CVE-2020-12641, CVE-2020-35730, CVE-2021-44026, CVE-2023-23397, CVE-2023-38831; Summary: APT28 (aka BlueDelta, Fancy Bear, or Forest Blizzard) has been attributed to a state-sponsored campaign targeting Western logistics entities and technology companies since 2022. The campaign uses a mix of previously disclosed tactics, techniques, and procedures (TTPs), including password spraying, spear-phishing, modifying Microsoft Exchange mailbox permissions for espionage purposes, and exploiting vulnerabilities in various webmail services like Roundcube, Horde, MDaemon, and Zimbra.

item.title: ZDI-25-296: Trend Micro Apex Central modTMCM Unrestricted File Upload Vulnerability
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Trend Micro Apex Central; CVE(s): CVE-2025-47866; Summary: This vulnerability allows remote attackers to upload arbitrary files on affected installations of Trend Micro Apex Central, requiring authentication to exploit. The issue stems from a lack of proper validation of user-supplied data, enabling the upload of arbitrary files and potentially allowing code execution in the context of IUSR.

item.title: ZDI-25-297: Trend Micro Apex Central widget getBlock Local File Inclusion Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Trend Micro Apex Central; CVE(s): CVE-2025-47867; Summary: This vulnerability allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code on affected installations of Trend Micro Apex Central, requiring authentication. The issue stems from the lack of proper validation of user-supplied data prior to passing it to a PHP include function, which can be exploited to execute code in the context of IUSR.

item.title: ZDI-25-298: Apple macOS MP4 File Parsing Memory Corruption Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Apple macOS; CVE(s): CVE-2025-31233; Summary: The vulnerability allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code on affected installations of Apple macOS, requiring user interaction. It exists within the parsing of MP4 files due to lack of proper validation of user-supplied data, resulting in memory corruption.

item.title: ZDI-25-299: Apple macOS acv2 Codec Converter Out-Of-Bounds Read Information Disclosure Vulnerability
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Apple macOS; CVE(s): CVE-2025-31208; Summary: The acv2 codec converter in Apple macOS allows remote attackers to disclose sensitive information through an out-of-bounds read information disclosure vulnerability. User interaction is required, and the issue stems from a lack of proper validation of user-supplied data, which can result in a read past the end of an allocated buffer.

item.title: ZDI-25-300: Apple macOS PDF Parsing Out-Of-Bounds Read Information Disclosure Vulnerability
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Apple macOS; CVE(s): CVE-2025-31209; Summary: This vulnerability allows remote attackers to disclose sensitive information on affected installations of Apple macOS. The flaw exists within the parsing of PDF files due to lack of proper validation of user-supplied data, resulting in a read past the end of an allocated buffer.

item.title: ZDI-25-301: Apple Safari Scrollbar Animation Use-After-Free Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Apple Safari; CVE(s): CVE-2025-31238; Summary: This vulnerability allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code on affected installations of Apple Safari, requiring user interaction. The flaw exists in the handling of scrollbar animation due to a lack of validating an object's existence before performing operations on it.

item.title: ZDI-25-302: Apple macOS CoreMedia Framework Memory Corruption Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Apple macOS CoreMedia Framework; CVE(s): CVE-2025-31239; Summary: The vulnerability allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code on affected installations of Apple macOS. User interaction is required, and the specific flaw exists within the CoreMedia framework due to a lack of proper validation of user-supplied data, resulting in memory corruption.

item.title: ZDI-25-303: Apple Safari SandboxBroker ZIP File Processing Out-Of-Bounds Read Information Disclosure Vulnerability
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Apple Safari; CVE(s): CVE-2025-24222; Summary: The vulnerability allows remote attackers to disclose sensitive information on affected installations of Apple Safari by reading past the end of an allocated buffer when processing ZIP files. User interaction is required, as the target must visit a malicious page or open a malicious file.

item.title: ZDI-25-304: Apple macOS JPEG Image Decoding Out-Of-Bounds Write Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Apple macOS; CVE(s): CVE-2025-31251; Summary: This vulnerability allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code on affected installations of Apple macOS by exploiting an out-of-bounds write in the JPEG image decoding functionality. User interaction is required, and the issue results from a lack of proper validation of user-supplied data.

item.title: ZDI-25-305: Apple XNU kernel vm_map Race Condition Local Privilege Escalation Vulnerability
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Apple XNU kernel; CVE(s): CVE-2025-31219; Summary: This vulnerability allows local attackers to escalate privileges on affected installations of Apple macOS. An attacker must first obtain the ability to execute low-privileged code on the target system in order to exploit this vulnerability, which exists within the handling of virtual memory allocations in the macOS kernel.

item.title: Hackers Target Mobile Users Using PWA JavaScript to Bypass Browser Security
item.description: A new injection campaign targets mobile users through malicious third-party JavaScript, delivering a Chinese adult-content Progressive Web App (PWA) scam. The attack injects scripts into compromised websites, filtering out desktop users and exclusively targeting mobile devices to deliver fake adult content zones and push malware downloads for Android and iOS devices.

item.title: 3AM ransomware uses spoofed IT calls, email bombing to breach networks
item.description: The article describes a targeted ransomware attack campaign conducted by a 3AM ransomware affiliate using email bombing and spoofed IT support calls to socially engineer employees into giving credentials for remote access. The attackers used tactics such as vishing via Microsoft Teams, Quick Assist abuse, and real phone phishing to gain access to corporate systems.
